code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:20 YO white M information technologist presents with moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs, moderate lethargy, severe weight loss and Diabetes. he is having symptoms 17-18 times a week, in spite of treatment. o:Height 173 cm, Weight 76.6 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, HbA1c HbA1c=9 %, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:administered insulin aspart - 100 mg/mL subcutaneous daily, performed HbA1c, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:a 22 yr old white m information technologist with C/O moderate lethargy, severe weight loss, moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs and Diabetes. o:Height 173 cm, Weight 76.4 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to endocrinology.

td.content: s:a white male information technologist aged 22 Ys with C/O moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs for 11 days that is frequent. pt also reports moderate lethargy, severe weight loss, Diabetes. Denies ever using tobacco pt has a history of excessive levels of alcohol consumption o:Height 174 cm, Weight 77.7 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 17, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered Basic Metabolic Panel, Arterial Blood Gas.
